facts.text: Dispute between the appellant company and its workmen as to bonus for the year 1954-55.
Dispute referred by Government of Mysore under Industrial Disputes Act, 1947 to Industrial Tribunal, Mysore, Reference I.T. No. 21 of 1957.
Gross profits of appellant: Rs. 9.46 lacs.
Full statutory depreciation allowed: Rs. 4.30 lacs.
Tribunal allowed Rs. 1.67 lacs for income-tax.
Appellant originally claimed working capital Rs. 43.85 lacs, revised to Rs. 36.70 lacs.
Tribunal calculated working capital as Rs. 7.85 lacs by excluding depreciation reserve of Rs. 36.24 lacs.
Evidence of Shri M. S. Vartak, Secretary of appellant company, that Rs. 36.70 lacs was used as working capital, accepted by tribunal.
Rs. 36.70 lacs working capital includes Rs. 14.56 lacs borrowed money on which interest was paid.
Tribunal allowed 3% return on working capital.
One month's wages: roughly Rs. 0.64 lacs.

legal_issues.text: Correct amount of income-tax deduction for bonus calculation.
Rate and amount of working capital on which return should be allowed as prior charge.
Provision for rehabilitation as prior charge.

petitioner_arguments.text: Income-tax should be deducted on Rs. 5.16 lacs (gross profits Rs. 9.46 lacs minus depreciation Rs. 4.30 lacs) at seven annas in the rupee, amounting to Rs. 2.25 lacs, not Rs. 1.67 lacs as allowed by tribunal.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Associated Cement Companies Ltd. v. Its workmen

petitioner_arguments.text: Return on working capital should be at 4% on Rs. 36.70 lacs (revised claim), not 3% on Rs. 7.85 lacs.
Remand case to allow evidence on rehabilitation.

court_reasoning.text: Appellant's contention on income-tax correct; should be Rs. 2.25 lacs on Rs. 5.16 lacs at seven annas per rupee.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Tribunal's Rs. 1.67 lacs incorrect per Associated Cement Companies.

court_reasoning.text: 3% return on working capital within tribunal discretion (2-4% range); no interference though recent trend is 4%.
Depreciation reserve cannot be excluded outright; return allowable if used as working capital, proved by evidence.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Tribunal wrong to exclude Rs. 36.24 lacs depreciation reserve per Tata Oil Mills and Petlad cases.

court_reasoning.text: Rs. 36.70 lacs used as per Vartak's evidence, but deduct Rs. 14.56 lacs borrowed money (interest already paid); return on Rs. 22.14 lacs at 3% = Rs. 0.66 lacs.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No return on borrowed money used as WC per Tata Oil Mills.

court_reasoning.text: No evidence on rehabilitation; too late for remand (year 1954-55); does not preclude future years.

Final calculations: Gross Rs. 9.46 - depr 3.32 = 6.14 - tax 2.25 = 3.89 - return capital 1.33 = 2.56 - WC 0.66 = surplus 1.90 lacs. Fair bonus 1.5 months wages (Rs. 0.96 lacs), i.e., additional half month.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Reduce from tribunal's one month additional.

holdings.text: Income-tax deduction modified to Rs. 2.25 lacs.
Return on working capital at 3% on Rs. 22.14 lacs (Rs. 0.66 lacs).
Available surplus Rs. 1.90 lacs; workmen entitled to additional bonus of half a month.

precedents_cited.case_name: Associated Cement Companies Ltd. v. Its workmen
precedents_cited.relevance: Law on profit bonus settled; income-tax calculation; return on working capital rate 2-4%.

precedents_cited.case_name: The Tata Oil Mills Co. Ltd. v. Its Workmen
precedents_cited.relevance: Depreciation reserve usable as working capital if actually used; no return on borrowed money.

precedents_cited.case_name: Petlad Turkey Red Dye Works Ltd. v. Dyes and Chemical Workers Union
precedents_cited.relevance: Utilisation of reserve as working capital to be proved by evidence, opportunity to contest.

statutes_cited.name: Industrial Disputes Act, 1947
statutes_cited.relevance: Reference of dispute to tribunal for adjudication.

outcome.summary: Appeal partly allowed; additional bonus reduced from one month to half a month based on corrected calculations of income-tax, working capital return; no rehabilitation allowed.
outcome.relief_granted: Reduction of additional bonus to half month (about Rs. 0.96 lacs total bonus, with rebate from income-tax).

key_quotes.text: "a return is allowed on the reserves used as working capital on the ground that if these reserves are not used for this purpose, the concern would have to borrow money and pay interest on that."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Explains basis for return on reserves as working capital, from Tata Oil Mills.

key_quotes.text: "the balance-sheet does not by itself prove the fact of utilisation of reserve as working capital and the law required that such an important fact... had to be proved by the employer by evidence."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: From Petlad case; emphasizes need for proof of utilization.

key_quotes.text: We therefore partly allow the appeal and reduce the additional bonus from one month to half a month.
key_quotes.speaker: court
